title: 109_s3606
content: The "Save Our Safety Net Act of 2005" includes provisions for ensuring adequate physician payment for emergency department visits, hospital outpatient fee schedule amounts, and adjustments to limit decline in payments for certain hospitals. It also addresses fairness in the Medicare disproportionate share hospital adjustment for rural hospitals. The "Save Our Safety Net Act of 2005" amends the Social Security Act to ensure adequate physician payment for emergency department visits by providing an additional 10 percent payment for services provided in an emergency department. SEC. 3. Ensuring adequate hospital outpatient fee schedule amounts for clinic and emergency department visits. Amendment to Section 1833(t) of the Social Security Act to adjust conversion factors for hospital outpatient fee schedules. Amendment to Section 1833(t) of the Social Security Act to adjust conversion factors for hospital outpatient fee schedules, including provisions for budget neutrality adjustments. The amendment to Section 1833(t) of the Social Security Act adjusts conversion factors for hospital outpatient fee schedules without reducing relative payment weights or the conversion factor for budget neutrality adjustments. New special rules are introduced for calculating Medicare OPD fee schedule amounts for clinic and emergency visits. The amendment to Section 1833(t) of the Social Security Act introduces special rules for calculating Medicare OPD fee schedule amounts for clinic and emergency visits, including substituting conversion factors and relative payment weights. The conversion factor for services in 2006 is calculated by multiplying the factor specified in the final rule from November 10, 2005, adjusted for reductions, by 1.10. The conversion factor for services in 2007 is determined by increasing the previous year's factor by the OPD fee schedule increase factor specified for that year. The relative payment weight for covered OPD services is calculated based on the group classification. The relative payment weight for ambulatory patient classification group 0601 in 2007 is specified in the final rule published on November 10, 2005. The relative payment weight for ambulatory patient classification groups in 2007 is established or revised under paragraph (2)(C) or (9)(A) for clinic and emergency visits. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is limited in making adjustments to ensure that amendments do not exceed estimated expenditures under part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The text chunk discusses the permanent extension of adjustments to limit decline in payments for certain hospitals under the Hospital Outpatient PPS. Amendments to the Social Security Act are made to apply to covered OPD services furnished on or after January 1, 2006. The text chunk amends the Social Security Act to exclude certain hospitals from the Medicare Disproportionate Share Hospital adjustment for discharges after October 1, 2006.
